name: Introduction to Archaeology
description: This course introduces students to the basic principles of Archaeology, including theories and methods of archaeological research, the origins of humankind, early human societies, and the material remains of past civilizations.

name: Archaeological Field Methods
description: This course focuses on the fundamentals of archaeological field techniques and methods used in the data collection process. Students will gain an understanding of field survey techniques, stratigraphic excavation, lithic analysis, and other methods used in archaeological research.

name: Archaeological Laboratory Methods
description: This course provides students with an understanding of laboratory techniques used in archaeological research. Students will learn about laboratory methods and procedures for cataloguing, preserving, and analyzing archaeological materials.

name: Historical Archaeology
description: This course focuses on the study of post-contact archaeological sites and material remains. Students will explore various aspects of historical archaeology, including the interpretation of historic documents, the analysis of artifacts, and the use of historical sources to interpret the past.

name: Archaeology of Ancient Cultures
description: This course explores the culture of ancient civilizations, primarily through archaeological evidence. Topics include religion, economy, social structure, politics, and the impact of cultural contacts.

name: Archaeology and Ancient Writing Systems
description: This course investigates the history and development of writing systems in ancient cultures. Topics include the decipherment of ancient scripts, the study of ancient literature, and the relationship between writing and political power.
